thread.title: Three players to leave Manchester United to make room for Antoine Griezmann and more transfer rumours
thread.title_full: Three players to leave Manchester United to make room for Antoine Griezmann and more transfer rumours

author: Charlotte Duncker
title: Three players to leave Manchester United to make room for Antoine Griezmann and more transfer rumours
text:
Sport Three players to leave Manchester United to make room for Antoine Griezmann and more transfer rumours Man Utd denied reports that the club had agreed personal terms with Atletico Madrid forward Antoine Griezmann but that hasn't stopped the gossip. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester United FC   
Antoine Griezmann is said to remain Manchester United's number one target despite some reports that Jose Mourinho is not interested in signing the striker. 
Many reports suggested a deal for the Atletico Madrid star had already been agreed, something which United denied, but Spanish news outlet Marca are now reporting that Mourinho is not interested in the striker. 
They report that the boss is concerned about how the 25-year-old would adapt to the style of the team. 
However, Ed Woodward is said to be keen for the deal to go through and it is expected that an offer will be made for the striker in the summer. 
The Independent is sure that a deal will be done and the club is looking at ways to fund the bid which will have to cover the 100million euro buy out clause. 
That report suggests that United will have to sell Wayne Rooney, Ashley Young and Marouane Fellaini in order to make way for the star striker. 
Another striker being linked to the club is Spurs and England star Harry Kane. 
According to ESPN the 23-year-old would be United's ideal summer signing but senior figures at the club have no expectation that he would be allowed to leave White Hart Lane. 
Meanwhile one of United's current strike force has been linked with a move away from the club. 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic signed a contract extension to keep him at the club until the end of next season but his agent Mino Raiola said that a move to Italy could be on the cards. 
Speaking to Radio CRC Raiola said: "As for Ibrahimovic, he's always been in love with Naples and the passion of the Neapolitans. I've always said that openly because he grew up in a family which was similar to the Neapolitans and then with me. 
"I know that De Laurentiis (Napoli chairman) knows him, and with Zlatan you never know what could happen." Read More
